From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: Heritrix 2 preview release (2.0.0-alpha) available
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Z0-sr8Vp3pFrfXh1wBMSUtRupwMhL6PzE0fB-u-Mu0P9
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Work on the next major revision of Heritrix has progressed to an 
alpha-quality stage, with most old and new functionality available. We 
encourage expert Heritrix users curious about upcoming changes to review 
this release and share their feedback.

This release is officially "2.0.0-alpha", but specifically build ID 
"heritrix-2.0.0-20070719.171117-4" from our automatic build system.

Details on downloading and using this release are available in the 
wiki-hosted Release Notes...

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/2.0.0-alpha+Release+Notes

Three notable differences in Heritrix 2 are:

(1) A more rigorous separation of the Web UI from the 'crawl engine', 
giving greater flexibility to control crawlers remotely.
(2) A new settings system, easing module development and offering new 
opportunities for dynamic configuration construction.
(3) A new mechanism for custom override settings for sets of related 
URIs, extending beyond Heritrix 1.x's domain-centric overrides.

A brief tutorial for exercising the new features via the new Web UI is 
hosted at...

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Tutorial

This preview is NOT recommended for casual Heritrix users or any 
production crawls; there are still significant gaps in UI/usability, 
functionality, and our usual pre-release acceptance testing. Additional 
guidance for developers and crawl operators to convert their 1.x 
configurations to Heritrix 2 will be offered with a future release.

Questions, comments, bug reports, suggestions welcome both here and via 
the Heritrix JIRA issue tracker:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER

- Gordon @ IA
